doc.field: Chesapeake Bay Protected Areas (1): City of Chesapeake GIS datasets (datastack)

This collection (stacked series) of datasets is provided to the UVA Library's Scholars' Lab by the GIS Division / Information Technology Department of the City of Chesapeake, Virginia, USA, and is provided AS-IS with no guarantees as regards to its accuracy or temporal currency. It pertains primarily to the infrastructure, service zones, and land use within the City of Chesapeake as well as related natural features. * // * The temporal extent of the datasets in the datastack is generally early 2005, but some datasets may include data that originated earlier. * // * Datasets/Layers included in this datastack (with non-exclusive list of included attributes): * City (Corporation) Boundaries * Political Boroughs * Planning Areas - incl. area name plus 1990 and 1999 population #s, density, and changes. * Street Centerlines - street name, additional geocoding/address matching info., ownership/access, VDOT hierarchical ranking, # of lanes, speed limit. * Parcels (polygon shape) - incl. parcel# and acreage. * Lot Lines (parcel subdivision boundaries) * Subdivisions - incl. name and tax map ids. * Property Access Easements * Land Use Plan - incl. zoning and land use codes and descriptions. * Zoning - incl. current and historical zoning codes. * Statistical Areas (city defined statistical areas, subsetted from Transportation Analysis Zones [TAZs] and planning areas, tied to census tracts) - incl. TAZ, planning area, census tract. * South Norfolk Business District Overlay * Chesapeake Bay Protected Areas * Elevation Contours - 2 ft. amsl contours. * Elevation Control Points - in feet * Hydology and Open Water Bodies - incl. name and classification (water body, river, island, ditch, lake) * Drainage Basins - incl. watershed, basin, and subbasin name. * Culverts (point locations) - incl. structure description, upstream and downstream elevations. * Culverts (cross-section profile lines) * Fentress Naval Auxiliary Landing Field Impact Zones, Noise Dispersion Impact Zones, and Restricted Zoning and Development Properties * // * For more detailed descriptions and explanations of the attribute codes used, please refer to the additional data dictionary metadata provided (see contact info for link). * // * These data were made available to the University of Virginia for educational and research uses only. Access is restricted to students, faculty and staff of the University of Virginia.
